dataIdInfo.idPurp: C-CAT - Merced County GHG and Multibenefit Scenario Planning Tool
dataIdInfo.idCredit: The Nature Conservancy, The Department of Conservation, Tukman Geospatial
dataIdInfo.idAbs:
Full tool guide is here: http://rebrand.ly/box4ba8b

C-CAT is a GIS model that that estimates how changes in land use, land management, and land cover affect landscape carbon storage and influence a variety of other potential benefits â€” including agricultural land values, water resources, biodiversity and human well-being. C-CAT is designed to help identify areas where conservation goals are aligned with opportunities to reduce net greenhouse gas emissions.

Planners can use the tool to run scenarios for an entire county or for any defined sub-area within the county. Because C-CAT is highly configurable, it can be used to model the effects of a wide range of land-use policies, conservation and land-management strategies, and restoration programs.
